text: Grevillea uniformis is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to a small area along the west coast in the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia. The shrub typically grows to a height of and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple undissected flat deltoid or trullate leaves with a blade that is in length and wide. It blooms between July and November and produces an axillary or terminal raceme regular inflorescence with white or cream flowers with white or cream styles. Later it forms smooth oblong glabrous fruit that are long. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== uniformis Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia
title: Grevillea uniformis
